newsitem.title: SLOVENIA: Slovenia shares down on profit-taking.
newsitem.headline: Slovenia shares down on profit-taking.

text.p: Slovenian shares fell 2.96 percent on Monday as profit-taking erased a chunk of last week's gains, traders said.
"(Despite last week's gains) there is no real reason for any long-term optimism because there is a lack of domestic money to sustain the rally," one trader said.
* The SBI index fell 40.3 points to 1,321.65.
* Overall 15 shares fell, two rose and 11 were untraded.
* Turnover dropped by half to 79.5 million tolars from, 159.9 million. -- Ljubljana newsroom, 386-61-125-8439
